Risk.1. Instability: Market volatility, structural change, or shifting client bases
Risk.2. Impact: Operational failures, financial loss, or brand damage
Risk.3. Containment: Limited mobility due to regulations, contracts, or resource caps
Risk.4. Deprivation: Lack of capital, labor, supply, or data
Risk.5. Proximity: Competitive encroachment or economic/geopolitical proximity threats
Risk.6. Obstruction: Internal bottlenecks, bureaucracy, or misaligned incentives
Risk.7. Sensory Overload: Information saturation, alerts, or too many KPIs at once

Relation.1. Communication: Interdepartmental messaging, stakeholder briefings, brand tone
Relation.2. Trust: Partnership agreements, leadership confidence, public trust
Relation.3. Disclosure: Investor updates, transparency obligations, PR management
Relation.7. Boundaries: Clear scopes of work, IP protection, legal frameworks

Reward.1. Gain: Revenue, profit, ROI, or customer base expansion
Reward.6. Alignment: Mission/brand coherence across actions and values

Risk.1. Abandonment: Fear of irrelevance, layoffs, or lost loyalty
Risk.2. Entrapment: Locked into failing contracts or dated models
Risk.3. Predation: Being quietly outmaneuvered by faster competitors
Risk.5. Isolation: Siloed teams, communication gaps, internal cold wars
Risk.7. Disintegration: Collapse of brand identity or values over time

Relation.1. Attachment: Sentimental ties to legacy systems, people, or routines
Relation.2. Mirroring: Adopting culture/identity from market or competitors
Relation.3. Enmeshment: Blurred lines between leader and company identity
Relation.4. Resonance: Emotional cues that influence internal alignment
Relation.5. Abandonment Sensitivity: Overreacting to churn or negative feedback
Relation.6. Unspoken Expectation: Cultural inertia, unvoiced norms or politics
Relation.7. Energetic Memory: Historic traumas — past crashes, scandals, failures

Reward.1. Safety: Consistent revenue, brand protection, stakeholder calm
Reward.2. Belonging: Strong team identity, inclusive culture, internal trust
Reward.3. Relief: Resolved tension — lawsuits closed, pressure off
Reward.5. Recognition (Unspoken): Silent nods of respect, earned influence
Reward.6. Continuity: Unbroken tradition, culture, or leadership legacy
Reward.7. Permission: Internal buy-in for bold actions or reinvention

Risk.1. Diminishment: Losing title, authority, or influence in hierarchy
Risk.2. Disempowerment: Being bypassed or made redundant by automation or politics
Risk.3. Exposure: Public failure, scandal, or leadership error
Risk.4. Loss of Control: Company direction shifts away from one’s vision
Risk.5. Dependence: Being propped up by others or seen as replaceable
Risk.6. Disapproval: Board criticism, public backlash, stakeholder revolt
Risk.7. Contradiction: Incongruent personal brand vs. organizational behavior

Relation.1. Recognition: Being spotlighted in reports, press, or keynote roles
Relation.2. Hierarchy: Chains of command, board roles, prestige signaling
Relation.3. Influence: Swaying company culture, investor mood, or strategy
Relation.4. Dependency: Gatekeeping resources, holding approvals or access
Relation.6. Possession: Treating projects, teams, or brand as extensions of self
Relation.7. Projection: Blaming subordinates or rivals for internal conflict

Reward.1. Dominance: Controlling strategy, markets, or internal direction
Reward.2. Admiration: Being publicly praised, awarded, or referenced
Reward.3. Influence: Shaping industry discourse or investor focus
Reward.4. Legacy: Founding narrative, named contributions, succession influence
Reward.5. Validation: Echoes of praise, alignment with personal narrative
Reward.6. Autonomy: Freedom to act without restriction or approval
Reward.7. Exclusivity: Private equity access, boardroom leverage, elite inner circles
